entry.title: Combined summary - Proposal to replace full blockchain with recent history plus UTXO Set
entry.summary: Dave Scotese has proposed an idea to relieve full nodes from storing the entire blockchain by using a UTXO set at a certain block height that is recognizable by humans and agreed upon by enough people as valid. He offered $50 worth of bitcoin to anyone who can provide him with a UTXO set from the Bitcoin client so that he can try to make a recognizable checkpoint for the blockchain. The author also discusses trust in third parties and mentions that generally, large composite groups are trusted so that no small group or individual can profit from cheating. Additionally, the author shares a memorable experience they created using the game of life with block 542322 of the Bitcoin blockchain. They wrote a script for the open-source Game-of-Life software Golly and shared it in a paste at https://pastebin.com/k5Ssc0qk. Furthermore, Dave Scotese encouraged more people to run full nodes without the hassle of long wait and loads of storage space in the future when the blockchain has grown to terabytes. He clarified that the correct block was 542322 regarding the references provided on imgur and pastebin. The author hopes that more people will start running full nodes without the hassle of long waits and loads of storage space. They envision this being possible in a few decades when the blockchain has grown to a few terabytes and the UTXO set is still just a few gigabytes. Overall, Dave Scotese's idea aims to save storage and make it easier to run a full node.
